original: Blume, Nils Riber, praktiserande läkare, Göteborg, f. 20/1/09 i Lysekil av stadsläk. Riber B. o. Elin Maria Högberg. G. 36 m. Karin Ericsson. Barn: Nils Jan Riber f. 38, Anna Karin Eli- sabeth 42, Ingrid Maria 45. — Stud:ex. i Uddevalla 27, med. kand. i Upps. 30 o. med. lic. där 35. Assist :läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. kir. avd. 36, dito v. dess med. avd. 36-37, v. Gbgs barnsjukh. med. avd. 37-38, tf. und:läk. v. Liliha-gens sjukh. fem mån. 37-38 o. 39-40, dito v. Renströmska sjukh. fem mån. 38-39, tf. und:läk. v. Sahlgr. sjukh. med. avd. tre mån. 39, bat:läk. i Fik res. 40, und:läk. v. Renströmska sjukh. 41, tf. und:läk. v. Holtermanska sjukh. tre mån. 42-43, prakt. läk. i Gbg sed. 42, tf. bitr. dispensärläk. i Gbg omkr. isiex mån. 44-46. Stmd ir^eis. t. London 36.
translated: Blume, Nils Riber, practicing physician, Gothenburg, b. 20/1/09 in Lysekil as the son of the city physician Riber B. and Elin Maria Högberg. Married in 1936 to Karin Ericsson. Children: Nils Jan Riber b. 1938, Anna Karin Elizabeth b. 1942, Ingrid Maria b. 1945. Education: graduated from Uddevalla in 1927, completed medical studies in Uppsala in 1930, and received a medical license there in 1935. Work experience: assistant physician at Sahlgren's Hospital surgical department in 1936, ditto at its medical department in 1936-37, at Gothenburg Children's Hospital medical department in 1937-38, temporary acting physician at Lilihaugen's Hospital for five months in 1937-38 and 1939-40, ditto at Renström's Hospital for five months in 1938-39, temporary acting physician at Sahlgren's Hospital medical department for three months in 1939, ship's physician for Fik Res. in 1940, acting physician at Renström's Hospital in 1941, temporary acting physician at Holterman's Hospital for three months in 1942-43, practicing physician in Gothenburg since 1942, temporary assistant dispensary physician in Gothenburg for about six months in 1944-46. Short-term stay in London in 1936.

structured.name: Nils Riber Blume
structured.shortBio: Nils Riber Blume (1909-01-20 - ) was a practicing physician in Gothenburg, Sweden. He was born in Lysekil as the son of the city physician Riber B. and Elin Maria Högberg. He graduated from Uddevalla in 1927, completed medical studies in Uppsala in 1930, and received a medical license there in 1935. Blume started his career as an assistant physician at Sahlgren's Hospital surgical department in 1936 and later worked at various medical institutions. In 1942, he began practicing as a physician in Gothenburg. He was also a temporary assistant dispensary physician in Gothenburg for about six months in 1944-46.
